result.execSummary:
The defendant Zameir Sanchez Wesly-Carter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Court costs due during term of probation. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

Absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants. Not to possess or consume controlled substances or prescription medication w/out a valid prescription. AODA and follow up deemed appropriate by the Agent. Obtain GED or HSED. Maintain full time work or school or combination of the two. Submit to DNA analysis.
Upon successful completion of probation and no new violations rising to the level of probable cause.

records.addlTxt:
8:48 AM Defendant Zameir Sanchez Wesly-Carter appeared by video from the Ozaukee County Jail, in custody.  Attorney Heather Dvoran in court for Zameir Sanchez Wesly-Carter.  Prosecuting attorney Benjamin Lindsay in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews case history. Court orally examines Defendant on waiver for preliminary hearing, accepts said waiver, and binds matter over for trial. State files the information. Counsel waives reading and enters not guilty plea.
Further proceedings scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Further proceedings on October 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Absolute sobriety. No alcohol. No drugs. Not to possess or consume controlled substances or prescription medication w/out a valid prescription.

1:24 PM Prosecuting attorney Antonella Aleman-Zientek in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Zameir Sanchez Wesly-Carter appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Rachel Marie Boaz in court for Zameir Sanchez Wesly-Carter. As a friend of the Court. Defendant will retain private counsel. Court advises of charges/penalties and finds probable cause. State recommends $500 cash bail w/conditions. Defendant is on PO hold. Counsel requests $50 cash bail. Court finds good cause to extend time limits. Court advises of right to counsel.
Status hearing scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 08:15 am.
